gov.fnal.ppd.dd.chat

Class MessagingClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.fnal.ppd.dd.chat.MessagingClient

  • public class MessagingClient
extends java.lang.Object

    The Client that can be run both as a console or a GUI

    Taken from the internet on 5/12/2014. @see

    Extensively modified by Elliott McCrory, Fermilab AD/Instrumentation, 2014

    Author:
    Elliott McCrory, Fermilab AD/Instrumentation

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  MessagingClient.ListenFromServer
      A class that waits for the message from the server and append them to the JTextArea if we have a GUI or simply System.out.println() it in console mode

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void connectionAccepted() 
      protected void connectionFailed() 
      void disconnect()
      When something goes wrong Close the Input/Output streams and disconnect not much to do in the catch clause
      void displayIncomingMessage(MessageCarrier msg)
      Overridable to enable other sorts of usages.
      void displayLogMessage(java.lang.String msg)
      To send a message to the console or the GUI.
      java.lang.String getName() 
      boolean isReadOnly() 
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      To start the Client in console mode use one of the following command > java Client > java Client username > java Client username portNumber > java Client username portNumber serverAddress at the console prompt If the portNumber is not specified 1500 is used If the serverAddress is not specified "localHost" is used If the username is not specified "Anonymous" is used > java Client is equivalent to > java Client Anonymous 1500 localhost are eqquivalent In console mode, if an error occurs the program simply stops when a GUI id used, the GUI is informed of the disconnection
      void retryConnection() 
      void sendMessage(MessageCarrier msg)
      Send a message to the server, converting it to a signed message if the messaging client, here, has the authority
      void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly) 
      boolean start()
      To start the dialog

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessagingClient

        public MessagingClient(java.lang.String server,
               int port,
               java.lang.String username)
        Constructor called by console mode server: the server address port: the port number username: the username
        Parameters:
        server - The name of the server, e.g., "localhost"
        port - The port number, e.g. 1500
        username - The name of the user you want to be identified as

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(MessageCarrier msg)
        Send a message to the server, converting it to a signed message if the messaging client, here, has the authority
        Parameters:
        msg - -- The message to sign and then send.

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the user name of this client in the messaging system

      • connectionFailed

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        When something goes wrong Close the Input/Output streams and disconnect not much to do in the catch clause

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        To start the Client in console mode use one of the following command > java Client > java Client username > java Client username portNumber > java Client username portNumber serverAddress at the console prompt If the portNumber is not specified 1500 is used If the serverAddress is not specified "localHost" is used If the username is not specified "Anonymous" is used > java Client is equivalent to > java Client Anonymous 1500 localhost are eqquivalent In console mode, if an error occurs the program simply stops when a GUI id used, the GUI is informed of the disconnection
        Parameters:
        args - Command-line arguments

      • isReadOnly

        public boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns:
        Is this client a rad-only client?

      • setReadOnly

        public void setReadOnly(boolean readOnly)
        Parameters:
        readOnly - -- Should this client be read-only?
